SEARCH VOCABULARY & ALIAS MAP (DEDUPED)
company identifiers: Vertiv, VRT
power: UPS, power distribution, rack PDU, switchgear, busbar, busway, AC power, DC power, telecom DC plant, rectifier, inverter
thermal: CRAC, CRAH, in-row cooling, chiller, free cooling, economization, heat rejection, evaporative cooling
liquid/high-density: liquid cooling, CDU, coolant distribution unit, direct-to-chip (DTC), RDHx, immersion cooling, dielectric fluid
software/ops: DCIM, remote monitoring, predictive maintenance, service SLA, commissioning, field service
BUSINESS SCOPE & BOUNDARIES
IN-SCOPE
critical digital infrastructure
mission-critical infrastructure
data center infrastructure (hyperscale, cloud, colocation/MTDC, enterprise/on-prem, edge/micro)
AI / HPC data center infrastructure (accelerated computing, GPU clusters, high-density racks)
edge computing infrastructure
telecom / communication networks infrastructure (telecom central office, wireless tower, 5G site power + cooling)
commercial & industrial critical environments
healthcare critical power
semiconductor fab critical power and cooling infrastructure
data center power systems (AC power management, DC power systems/telecom DC plants)
UPS systems (single-phase UPS, three-phase UPS, rack UPS)
rack power distribution (rack PDUs / intelligent PDUs)
switchgear (low voltage / medium voltage)
busbar / busway / busbar trunking systems
thermal management (data center cooling, high-density cooling)
liquid cooling systems (direct-to-chip liquid cooling, coolant distribution units/CDU, rear-door heat exchangers/RDHx)
immersion cooling infrastructure (dielectric fluids, immersion ecosystem)
modular / prefabricated data centers
containerized data centers
racks, cabinets, integrated rack systems
KVM switches, serial consoles
IT infrastructure management hardware + software
DCIM / monitoring software
remote monitoring services
predictive maintenance services
field services (installation, commissioning, testing)
maintenance contracts / service SLAs
services & spares (consulting, training, spare parts)
energy storage solutions (UPS batteries, battery energy storage systems/BESS)
OUT-OF-SCOPE (HARD EXCLUDES; SUPPRESS NOISY QUERIES)
cloud services (SaaS / PaaS / IaaS as service delivery)
operating/running data centers (colocation landlord / REIT operations)
telecom service delivery (consumer/mobile plans, carrier services)
server manufacturing; GPU / CPU manufacturing
storage arrays (SAN/NAS)
generic building HVAC / comfort cooling (non-critical)
generic facility management software
business applications (ERP / CRM)
semiconductor fabrication process tools
renewable generation ownership (solar/wind farms)


Prompt
Conduct Company Research for Company Context
Conduct detailed research on Vertiv. Using the above criteria conduct in-depth research about the company, and produce the required context about the company that can be used to generate contextual search queries. Use sharp and concise language, not narratives. Note only current situation of the company, historical data is not needed. All information must be absolutely true. Look at reputed sources for information. Information is to be consumed by an LLM so the formatting is meant to be easily consumable by LLMs. Dont give as Json, give as text.

Business scope & boundaries
What businesses, markets, and activities are in scope
What is explicitly out of scope (to prevent noisy queries)


End markets served
Primary and secondary markets
Market terminology used externally (industry language)


Customer archetypes
Buyer types (e.g., hyperscalers, colocation, enterprise, industrial)
How these customers are referred to in news and filings


Demand triggers & dependency points
External events that cause demand to rise/fall
Structural dependencies (capex cycles, buildouts, refresh cycles)


Upstream ecosystem dependencies
Industries or actors that drive demand indirectly
Capex owners, infrastructure owners, platform players


Supply chain & fulfillment dependencies
Critical inputs/components
Logistics or capacity dependencies that appear in external news


Regulatory & policy exposure surfaces
Policies, permits, trade rules, standards that can show up in news
Government bodies and regulators to watch


Geographic exposure map


Regions/countries where signals matter
Location-specific terminology used in reporting and media


Competitive & substitution landscape
Competitors, alternative technologies, adjacent solutions
Terms journalists and analysts use to describe competition


Macro sensitivity surfaces (not macro data itself)
Macro variables that matter to this business
Where macro news intersects with customers or suppliers


External event types that matter
Announcements, capex plans, expansions, shutdowns, delays
Policy changes, shortages, strikes, financing changes
Search vocabulary & alias map
Product and solution keywords
